column4: Does anybody know how I can enable desktop effects? My PC has a graphics card built into the motherboard, and when I run lspci it says that the graphics card is unknown and lists the manafacturer as Intel.
what happens when you try to turn effects on through System-Preferences-Appearance-Visual Effects?

well I have 7.04 at the moment, it's a fresh installation and I haven't upgraded to 8.04 yet but when I do System > Preferences > Desktop Effects the screen goes white and then after a few seconds comes back to normal without the effects enabled.
I think your best bet is to do a fresh installation of 8.04
you're really making it unnecessarily difficult by trying to get an unsupported old version to work, especially if you want advanced features like 3D effects.
yes, your graphics card should be fine
I have reasons for what I am doing. There is a reason I have 7.04.
okay then stick with it, but get by without effects.
I am upgrading to 8.04 as we speak.
okay, if you succeed, you'll be fine (I think)
it should be, but if you listen carefully, you'll hear the echo of the squeals of those who have tried and failed
I have upgraded in this way before.

you see my hardware was unsupported. Every single Linux distro I would try and install on my new machine would fail during installation with some kind of error message. So Intel made a 7.04 ISO image with the hardware drivers implemented. I burnt the ISO and installed, and that's the reason I'm using 7.04.
have you tried an intrepid beta yet? I'd be curious how that goes
